result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie L. Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with each other

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.
Absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior approval of agent.
Eligible for CIP and SAP. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Prior: 3715 Troy St, Wausau, WI 54403
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 14CF888, filed in 14CF1039)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:09 am 
INCLUDES 14CF888, 14CF1039, AND 14CM1117. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Wright Laufenberg.  

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF1039. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions def as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 

PLEA HEARING IN ALL. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to: 
In 14CF888: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Retail Theft - Alter Price/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM1117: Ct. 1 (Operate w/out valid license/repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF888: Amended Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF1039: Ct. 1 (Deliver THC/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Laufenberg makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On both counts: 3 years imprisonment to run concurrent to each other - 1 year IC and 2 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior approval of agent; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; DNA sample and surcharge; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 148 days sentence credit in each file. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands def to sheriff's dept for transport to WI State Prison System.

and Demand for Discovery & Inspection - States
